column2: Morgie, 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My 12 year old daughter has been on Metadate 40 mg one per day for about 3 months and it seems to work well for her. We are still experiencing days when she isn't able to sit still or stop talking (most of the time jumping from one subject to the next,without finishing).

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am taking Metadate CD 30mg 2 a day. I have found out that this dosage works for me. It helps me stay focused throughout the day. I have tried other meds before this one and they did not work for me. Metadate is the only one that I have used that works well. I   have no loss of appetite when I take it. I am more focused then ever!

column2: JustMom, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter began taking 10mg July 2011 and is now on 20mg based on height/weight.  I have read several reviews about the bad effects of Metadate.  The drug is only good for 10-11 hrs and then it loses its effectiveness (as with all drugs).  I know when Metadate is no longer working for the day and YES it is usually done with by the time my daughter gets home from school.  Jekyle and Hyde, but its doable.  Calming/breathing exercises.  Before Metadate my daughter was having severe problems in school. Aggression, emotional outburst, etc.  Since being on Metadate she is more focused, is excelling, there have been zero behavioral issues in school (aside from talking). I don't want my daughter to be on a drug for the rest of her life, but for right now...this works.  She sees a therapist, has a behavioral coach and has been given tools to assist her in making better choices so that she can get off the drug.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Caregiver)
column9: full of energy amd focused

column2: MorganJamee, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was put on Metadate about a year ago 20mg 2 times a day. It helps me focus on what i need to do such as my school work. I have seen a difference in getting things I need to get done done. I only take one a day because I do not like the way two of them make me feel. I have lost a lot of weight because of this drug. I would say that is one of the biggest down falls about this drug. I have no appetite anymore and I have to make myself eat when I take it. I get dry mouth all the time as well. Over all this drug has helped me in school, work and daily things.

column2: angelscancu, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: This paticular drug has worked the best for both my kids, one having ADD and one being ADHD with autism. I know its otherwise known as ritalin, but metadate CD releases in the brain different then Ritalin without near as many side effects. I have been a very happy parent with this drug, it has gotton my son into the gifted program at school, to help him focus, and concentrate easier, he is very smart, and gets along with all different kinds of kids.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: At the beginning this drug was great I actually didn't start taking meds until high school for my adhd. I am a senior in college now at a very highly ranked college and have found that even with an increased dose the metadate is not working. I do not know if it is my diet now or my lack of exercise because my sport season is over and it is finals but I am finding it very hard to focus on anything and I feel extremely slugish. I am going to stop taking my 40mg over break to try and see if that helps especially with foggy mind feeling I get

column2: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My son just stared Metadate CD 10mg once a  day 3 days ago. Too soon to make any trueevaluation yet. However I have noticed the beginnings of mood swings, and the "zombie" stare. Not to thrilled. Was wondering if anyone had height growth rate problems with their child while on Metadate. When he was on Vyvanse one of the main reasons we took him off was beacuse he was 7 years old and people thought he was 4 years old. No growth in height and SEVERE weight loss. I know the height issue is a  minor concern compared to the other major side effects, but in a childs mind it is HUGE and contributes to the problem.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed with ADHD at age 12. I was very emotional, very troubled. I was abusive to my family and out of control. I was disorganized and manipulative when I wanted something. I was embarrassing and impulsive. When I was first put on this medication, it took a bit to get the dosage right. Over the last few years the doc has adjusted the dose a few times and I can tell you it was a miraculous improvement the first time the dosage was finally gotten right. It takes a while, but stay in there. Don't just stop taking it because you think its not working. Work with a doc to get the dosage right. This medicine saved me from sinking into a world of depression because my forgetfulness and disorganization had only led to failure. The failure made me feel inadequate to the point that I thought of taking my life. This medication helped me to learn how to be organized and to set goals for myself that I could for the first time ACTUALLY accomplish! I finished what I started, and that was something I had never done before. If I had not been put on the medication when I was, I think I would have taken a very different path. Sure it's not perfect, but it helps. I know how to accomplish goals now and control my emotions. Sometimes its still tough, but I hang in there.  It's done great things for me.

column2: shima,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years
column9: My son was 8years old, phycotherapist gave this medication to my son. Now he is 10yars old his eye sight is incrisingly getting poor. His body did not grow as it should, low interest for eating.  Social sevices took my son from me.  Because his father madeafalse case againest me. My son refuse to listen to him. He beat him torture him. Social services advice him to take Phycotherapyst to get controll of him.  Now I am helpless what damages this drug did to y son.

column2: joke345, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: ive been on this forever never helped my grades really was to busy with everything else which this is suppose to pervent but the biggest draw back i have is i cant sleep donts happen not to mention i cant be in groups of people freaks me out when i was younger i was the kid u saw and heard in school i had all the answers just couldnt get them from my head to the paper

column2: amanda junior, 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
lisa,  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My child was on this for 5 years at 60mg a day,it helped a great deal with school  her grades really improved.  the doctor also gave her 20mg of prozac.  i didn't givre it to her over long breaks from school. I could take care of her without it.  everyone told me that they could tell when she had not taken it.

column2: demont33n, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I would recomend all parents take their kids off this drug i was on it when i was 6 yrs old and went from being an active child to a complete zombie to the world my nephew 9 yrs old was recently on this and in the middle of playin his fav game he froze up and was uncomprehensive for 25 min..this drug will turn your child insane litterally i still experience unwanted behaviors even being off of it for 16 yrs..the best med you can give your child is love and attention

column2: matratmom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My 10 year old son is on this medicine he takes 20 mg once a day he has been on this for just a little over a year. It seems to have made a huge difference at school but at home he can get very angry and emotional he also blinks ALOT..Very confused

column2: concerned mom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son is 9 and has been on metadate for 2 years. His grades have increased dramatically and he maintains e conduct. the problem is hes so quiet its almost scary even his teachers say you have to look up and see him to even know he's in the room. At home hes totally isolated and would prefer to stay in his room for hours at a time, i have to make him come out for family time. his appetite is slim to none and he constantly complains of a stomach ache. Now his dr. wants him on 40 mg and blue cross doesnt cover any adhd meds so its 187.00 a month. I think as with any medication it comes with good and bad sides.

column2: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My 9 yr old son has been on this medication since June.  Since the beginning of school he is not focused, doesn't remember to bring home all his homework and has frequent outbursts...going to the drs tomorrow hoping to get this changed, this is the 4th medication he has been on.

column2: Mom who cares, 3-6 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My 5 year old started taking it 3 months ago.  The drug was a God send at first, after his first drug caused him to act out violently.  We were up to 20 mg. I went to refill it and everything went to hell.  His first pill sent him on a violent tantrum at school.  Throwing chairs at his friends and teachers and physically going after them kicking and screaming. He has never missed a pill.  I even called the pharmacy to make sure the manufacturer was the same and nothing had changed.  To me it looked like there was a lot more medicine in the capsule then the pryor month.  I give him the capsule every morning in his applesauce.  I don't know what changed or why, but I finanlly had to stop the medicine this week.  He would cry and tell us he hated this world.  I feel like there is definately something wrong with this medicine and I don't know if the FDA can look into it. I don't think I am imagining more medicine in those pills then last time.  I just know, I want my happy child back.

column2: Louise,  Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: I give this medication to my daughter and it helps her ability to focus very effectively.  I do no like when it has worn of because the range of emotions she goes thru. Once we ealized that it was the medds wearing off, it was easily managed with just good old mommy and me down time.

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: My child takes this medication. She does not do well with it. She is very over-emotional, and irratable. when she does not take the meds (on the weekends) she is fine.

column2: blssr0687, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: my son has been on 30mg of medadatein the morning before school and then 5mg of methylphenidate at 1pm at school just to get him through the rest of the school day when he  gets home at 3:30 he is a holy terror he does not listen and is compleatly defiante with anything and everything and i send him to bed at 8o'clock and he still isnt to sleep until around 10 i dont know how hw makes it through the day without falling asleep but he is doing a lot better in school maybe the dosage needs to be uped in the afternoon at 1 i dont even know if that would work he might not sleep at all at night that is what i am afraid of

column9: wanted to see what they looked like

column9: my son id on metadate for a year now. and he does good with it at school. but when he comes home in the afternoon he twiches alot like shrugging his shoulders and bliknking of the eyes. and i want to know if this is normal? and will this drug affect him when he gets older?

column2: 3-6 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My son was diagnosed with ADHD when he was five years old. We went through several medications before starting Metadate a few months ago. We started on 20 mgs and he has increased his ability to concentrate at school and his behavior has greatly improved. However, as soon as he gets home he is a different child. He is incredibly irritable and often displays signs of depression. He cries often and very easily, which is outside of his normal happy, playful, loving behavior. He complains of headaches almost everyday. I am very happy with his great improvements at school however I miss my son. He has not been himself sinse starting this medicine. He doesn't eat well or sleep much at night however he complains of being tired all of the time. I called the Dr. today and got his dose cut in half so we'll see what happens.

column2: hobo, 0-2 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: hyperness

column2: samsmom, 3-6 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: Somedays this med seems to work great!  All school work is done and behavior is wonderful.  Other days it is like he hasn't taken anything at all.  Overall we have had no adverse side effects whatsoever, so I am very happy with this choice for now.

column2: restless with adhd, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: For about six years, I have been taking this, and I think it has helped me sooo much. When I was nine, I couldn't concentrate, I was mouthy, I couldn't sit still if my life depended on it. Now I can concentrate, and my parents say I'm an angel. The main thing that I don't like about Metadate, is that I CAN'T sleep at night. I stay up for hours, reading and listening to music, and then when I have to get up at 4:30 every morning, and go to school, my mood isn't the best. Does anyone have any ideas for what I could do? It would make school sooooo much easier for me to stay awake and active during. I mean, I do get tired at night, but I just can't fall asleep. It's really a drag.

column2: memegamez, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It worked for a while but soon it made me sleepy often. Because of the sleepiness i slept in school, got behind, couldnt consintrate and this is what the pill was suspose to help me not do.

column2: amazon80, 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter has been on medication for her adhd since she was 4 years old. We put her on metadate cd about 1 1/2 years ago. It started out ok, but her attitude has gotten alot worse she is really mouthy and hateful she hardly ever says anything nice anymore, she has started cussing again and her talking has increased ten fold she is never quiet.  She is currently taking 30 mg. and she has built up a tolerence , it doesn't even slightly effect her now, she is also complaining of heartburn like pain the minute she eats or drinks anything and she has been having really bad headaches about every other day.She also does not sleep well at all she always has bad nightmares. I want to change her medication but there are really no other medications out there that i trust. Concerta made her lose so much weight you could see all her bones. She eats a little better on metadate but she is still almost 20 lbs underweight for her age group.

column2: OWCgirl, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have ADHD all of my life.  I have tried ritalin and Strattera and neither have worked as well as Metadate.  However, I find that i do have appetite loss and when I am coming down off of my medication, I  become irritable and extremely hungry because of the aforementioned appetite loss.  But overall, I have seen a dramatic difference in my ability to focus and all of it without the Zombie affect. I would recommend this drug to anyone who is ADHD.

column2: mvalish, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication since I was 9. I was previously on Ritalin, which didn't even make a dent. I am now 20 and still wish to remain on Metadate CD but due to insurance, I can't so, thanks blue cross .

column2: allibali, 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)

column9: I have not liked the experiance of tis medication, I fell that there are many others that may better uit the issuses that my child has nad that this is not the one for him. I think that there are things that have to be concidered with the use of a medication.

column2: KDCannon, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son has been on different strengths of Metadate for 2 years now. He was on Ritalin, and some medicine that they recalled.The effects have been wonderful.Off his medicine he is a complete handful, on it he's a straight A student,this medicine is controlled release so it works throughout the day, if it wears off too quickly or is having major side effects, that needs to be discussed with the Physician.Most importantly medicine alone does not work.Counseling and coping skills needs to be a part of treatment as. Medicine is not a cure its a treatment

column2: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)

column9: I have had ADD since 2nd grade. This drug has been a god send since I switched from Ritalin. I think it does a good job of evening the side effects and I do not get over stimulated. I have had to up my dosage a few times just because I am building a tolerance. Overall I am very satisfied.

column2: sparkles, 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: My 9 year son has ADD (non-attentive type)  he has been on this for 8 months and what a difference!  His overall attitude has changed from being somewhat difficult to a desire to do well and to please.  There are some issues with decreased appetite during they day, but by 4pm he makes up for it with a vengeance.  His sleep time has been pushed back about an hour, but he has no problems getting up in the am.  Overall it has been an incredible improvement, since starting this he has been moved out of the special ed. class and his self-confidence has been dramatically increased.

She comes home from school with all of her lunch.  She just has nibbled on her sandwich and eaten nothing else!!  Is the Metadate causing this?  Has anyone else had this problem?  I have an 8 year old that is on this same medication and she eats just fine.  I just don't know what to do.  Could someone please give me some insight?

column2: prozacplease, 19-24 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: this drug causes the worst "come down"and will make your kid a burn out stoner who cant do anything

column2: pat, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son started taking this med at 3 1/2 yrs.  He was uncontrollable, irritable, would not sleep, and you couldn't understand a word. This med slowed him enough to speak clearly, concentrate, and follow directions. He still struggles some in evenings but overall is soo much better. Coupled with clonidine0.1mg before bed he sleeps through most nights. It has been a wonderful turnaround.

column2: misi, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: We decided it was time to do something when my 5 year old was kicked out of school twice in the first two weeks of kindergarten. His doctor started him on 20 mg and we noticed a difference the first day. before he started on meds he couldnt write his name, count past 5, or say his abc's. within two days of meds he could write his full name, count to ten and could knew almost the whole alphabet. He has mood swings once in a while and bedtime is a mess but all in all this med. has done wonders, we didnt even have to go through any trial and error this medication has been really good for him. we have only had to up the dose once in the last 9 months and that was last month. Dealing with the rare mood swings and bedtime problems is a small price to pay for the happiness and well being of my child.

column2: 123456, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

It makes me feel nervous (but awake).  It's kind of like drinking 5 cups of coffee in the morning.  But I can definately feel it wear off before I leave work.  Not sure if I should ask for a smaller evening dose because I do not want to be up all night.

column2: Metadate 20mg Cap, 3-6 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)

column2: Female  (Caregiver)
column9: My son is 5 years old and has been taking this medication since November. He started off with 30mg and now it has been increased to 40mg. My son's behavior is still somewhat the same. column2: ricgetc, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My 8 year old son has been taking this medication for over a year and we are very pleased with the results.  For the first couple months he would become very agitated/moody in the evenings, but we stuck with it (like the doctor told us to), and are very glad we did.  He no longer experiences these nightly mood swings and is doing excellent in school - one of the top students in his class.  My only complaint is that it seems to wear off by about 3:30 pm; however, it lasts through the school day, which is where he needs it the most.  The plus side, he usually eats a really good dinner.

column2: wlmead, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My 7 year old daughter was diagnosed about a month ago with ADHD and has been on this drug it has been very effectful she is getting her work done in class and is able to pay attention to what is going on. She also is very easy to handle in the evenings once she gets home.

column2: pengrosati, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was diagnosed freshman year of college (four years ago).  I have been taking this drug for 3+ years now.  I find that I am able to think clearly, get organized and forcus. column2: zaknjakmom, 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver)
column9: My son (8yrs) has been on this medication for almost a year now. He started at 10mg and has now moved up to 30mg over the past year. He has also had upset stomach and at times becomes overly angry. It started out working great but he quickly developed a tolerance and I don't know what to do. I didn't even know what to say to him other than we will see the doctor in the morning.

column2: Uniqueness82, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I started my son on this med on oct 18th, I noticed a difference in him the first day! I found that my son is getting bad stomach pains and he crashes really hard in the evenings, very irritable and agry, my doctor told me to stick it out for a couple weeks and the pain would subside, she was right, and he doesnt crash as hard in the evenings anymore, Im glad I gave it a try instead of getting freaked and stopping so shortly into it. At first my son starting saying he was a bad person and got more depressed, but the symptoms have eased and are almost not there anymore, he can focuse in school and no more referrals to the principle, and he has his friends back as well, I know that we will have to increase his meds over time and possibly add another med to the mix. For now he is doing really well minus the come downs and it has made a good difference for him and our family.

column2: mother247, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)

column2: 3-6 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: My son is now 6yrs old and Metadate is the second medication we have tried.  Of the two, this one works best. column9: After struggling with ADD all my life, I began taking metadate CD with great results.  It is so wonderful to be able to accomplish things, prioritize my day, organize my own thoughts, etc.  What a blessing!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: It has worked great but I have been super irratable in the evenings. I take 40mg in the morning and by 5 pm I feel a little groggy and grouchy. But it has been so long since I have been able to concentrate and be productive during the day. This frug has enabled me to accomplish my goals.

column2: wpanther87, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My son has been on Metadate CD for 6 months now and has had to have his dose increasedd three times so far.  It doesn't seem to work after 2:00 pm.  Each time he builds up a tollerance for the medication his symptoms return and his dose has to be increased.  I am over all not satisfied with this medication.  My daughter has been on this medication for 3 months now with similar results.  I'm not sure why it's not working for them.

column2: golfjrk, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: My 7 year old son and I have both been diagnosed with ADHD.  I took the drug with little positive results.  I would "crash" hard in the early evening with a total lack of energy and a bad temper.  The drug made me "zombie like" during the day and very irritable during the night.  We treat our son with the same drug, coupled with psychological treatment through counseling and have seen a tremendous positive change in his behavior both in the home and at school.  He does have to take a low dose anti-depressant which has helped with the nighttime "crashes".  The medication has given us back our son after therapy alone proved useless.  We didn't tell his 1st grade teacher he was using it at first, just to make sure he really was getting a positive effect instead of a parents bias.  Our son doesn't seem to have the same "zombie" effect that I did.

column2: Joan, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Iam a 49year old female and have struggled with ADHD as long as I can remember. Of course when I was a child I was just labled as never paying attention in class or low grades D/T not trying. On my own I found ways to compensate. But now since I started Metadate CD I actually feel like a new person! Life has opened up for me and I can accomplish so much more in one day than I ususlly would in a month! It is never to late. I take (2) 20mg in the morning.

column2: 7-12 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My granddaughter is doing so much better.  Her doctor never thought she would be able to mainstream at school, but she has & is getting good grades.  Her behavior has improved tremendously.

column2: patrick17109, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i have been on at least 8 other drugs for my adhd and none of them have ever done to me what this one has i would get flashes of rage followed by a feeling of being lost i have just terminated use of this drug just after a week and i would never ever try this again yes it worked for the attention span but the side effects made completing tasks almost impossable.upset stomach all the time fits of rage and simply feeling like you are loseing your mind is what i was dealing with on this. if you are going to take this drug be very careful the first 2 days were perfect no problems then the side effects started to show

column2: 7-12 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: my son has done wonderful on this drug( mom typing of course)

column2: babette111, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This drg did nothing for me.

column2: LJS, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver)
column9: MY SON IS DEAF AND WAS DIAGNOSED W/ADHD MANY YEARS AGO.HE, LIKE SO MANY OTHERS, HAS TRIED MANY DIFFERENT DRUGS AND THIS HELPS HIM THE MOST.THERE IS SOME MOODYNESS AND IRRATABLILITY, BUT NOTHING THAT WE CANT HANDLE.WITH ALL OF THE CHALLENGES HE HAS TO FACE, THIS MEDICINE HAS BEEN WONDERFUL.

My son was diagnosed in the first grade, we had tried several different medications b/4 this one. What a difference this medication made - its been great - no side effects etc. He continues on the medication and is now in 11th grade!
When taking this drug I experience terrible mood swings as it starts to wear off. Concentration is even harder during that time. I become irritable and sometimes sleepy while taking this medication.

column2: OBLIVIOUSavior, 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i've had add since first grade, and... it pretty much sucks to try and concentrate on one thing for too long. like, my mind wanders so much, right?i take 30 mg of metadate and i can just... go. y'know? like, it's amazing. i've gotten all sorts of medicine thrown at me, ritalin, aderal, concerta... none of it's worked as well as metadate cd has. great stuff.

column2: justamom_2, 3-6 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: My daughter takes this medication.  Easy to use, effective, minimal side affects - and occured when first starting treatment.  She now able to focus clearly in school, pay attention, and seems happier and more adjusted to kids her age.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: in the beginning which my 4 year old child has been on for  a little over a month was very effective but i see some mood changes in the morning before the medicine is given the last few days he acts out alittle in the morning like he has before i opted to put him on medicine
